page.title: 01Nevetts Old Peoples Home
page.content: Nevetts was opened in 1975. It can accomodate forty eight people, on two floors, connected by stairs and a lift. Each floor has two lounges, a small kitchen and twelve single or double rooms.There is a central dining room downstairs.There are four officers. Officer in charge: Mrs. Jacklin. Deputy officer in charge: Mr. Throne. Assistant officer in charge: Mrs.Wielson.Residential social worker: Mrs.Pickering. The officers work in shifts. There is always at least one officer on duty at a time. When it is their shift they stay over night. Meal times are as follows, Breakfast: 8.00a.m. Lunch:12.00 noon.Dinner: 6.00p.m.On Wednesday,the residents can go to an Art Class,and on Friday a Sewing Group.We interviewed Mr.Throne and five residents,who enjoyed living at Nevetts,and really like the meals.
